meanings.definition: Whingier (comparative adjective): more inclined to complain or whine
meanings.sent1: She became even whingier when she didn't get her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The child was whingier than usual after missing his nap.
meanings.sent3: His cat seemed whingier than him when it didn't get the right treats.
meanings.sent4: The old car sounded whingier than a rusty gate when it started up.
meanings.sent5: The storm grew whingier as the wind howled louder and louder.

meanings.definition: Whingier (adverb): in a more complaining or whining manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke even whingier about the situation after hearing the news.
meanings.sent2: He complained whingier than anyone else in the group.
meanings.sent3: The dog howled whingier than usual when left alone.
meanings.sent4: The wind blew whingier through the trees as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: Her voice grew whingier with each passing complaint.
